titles.title: Providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 2317) to amend the Lobbying Disclosure Act of 1995 to require registered lobbyists to file quarterly reports on contributions bundled for certain recipients, and for other purposes and providing for the consideration of the bill (H.R. 2316) to provide more rigorous requirements with respect to disclosure and enforcement of lobbying laws and regulations, and for other purposes.

action.text: The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 110-167, by Ms. Castor.
Rule provides for consideration of H.R. 2317 and H.R. 2316.

calendar.text: Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 65.

action.text: DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H. Res. 437.
On ordering the previous question Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 224 - 195 (Roll no. 415).

vote.text: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 224 - 197 (Roll no. 416).

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

bill.summary: 5/24/2007--Passed House without amendment. Sets forth the rule for consideration of: (1) H.R. 2317 (Lobbying Transparency Act of 2007); and (2) H.R. 2316 (Honest Leadership and Open Government Act of 2007). Amends Rule XXV (Limitations on Outside Earned Income and Acceptance of Gifts) of the Rules of the House of Representatives to exclude from its gift ban exception free attendance at an event (currently, widely attended event) permitted under the Rule.
